channel.title: Commute on PLA Cycling Log
channel.description: Recent content in Commute on PLA Cycling Log

item.title: Commute Thursday March 21, 2019
item.description: Misting morning and clear afternoon. Pretty good commute if I forget about bubba babbling about getting off the road or end up in pieces. Jeez. 98% of automobile drivers behave properly. About once a day some dude, usually in a truck, has to tell me to get off the road. This time the passenger opened his door on Hwy 17-A and yelled. Stay classy bubba. Oh well. Ride on. â˜®

item.title: Commute Tuesday March 19, 2019
Commute Thursday March 14, 2019
Commute Tuesday March 12, 2019
item.description: Beautiful weather today made for an enjoyable commute. Except for bubba yelling at me to get off the f’ing road at Black Tom Rd & Hwy 17-A intersection it was a chill ride home. My Anker 10,000mAh battery only lasted about 5 months. I’ve been attempting to charge it for 3 days without luck. The way I mount it on my bike it catches sweat so the connectors are corroded. Probably will buy another and flip it upside down this time.

item.title: Commute Thursday March 7, 2019
item.description: Chilly start. Temperatures were in the twenties this morning. Super nice this afternoon. Clear blues skies and mild temperatures. This is the second commute on my Priority 600 with Pinion gearbox. While I’m riding the 600 I keep bemoaning the resistance I feel compared to Old Yeller. The commute takes about 5 minutes longer on the 600. I need to get over the added weight and resistance. Riding to lunch and dinner on the 600 is perfect.

item.title: Commute Friday March 1, 2019
item.description: Intrigued at the prospect of fewer drivetrain issues I bought a Priority 600 with a Pinion gearbox. Assembled last night and rode to work today. Initial reaction is it is a smooth ride but slow. The rolling resistance with the big 650b tires is noticeable as well as the resistance of the belt drive. At this point I don’t see it replacing Old Yeller. I’m pretty sure I’m going to get rid of the Defy 3 though.

item.title: Commute Tuesday February 26, 2019
Commute Tuesday February 19, 2019
item.description: The low temperature on the PM commute (41â„‰) was cooler than the AM commute (44â„‰). The wind was kicking all day. Headwind on the AM ride and a tailwind on the way home. Difference of 14 minutes. Always happy with a sub 50 minute commute. 1:02:53 vs 49:04 moving time. Became an East Coast Greenway Alliance member today. I would love to safely cycle from Charleston to Beaufort one day. ðŸ¤ž

item.title: Commute Friday February 15, 2019
Commute Tuesday February 12, 2019
Commute Thursday February 7, 2019
Commute Wednesday February 6, 2019
Commute Tuesday February 5, 2019
item.description:
Absolutely perfect weather. Highs in the 70’s and clear blue sky. What a way to start the Year of the Pig. I almost ran over a rabbit. One hopped out in front of me on Hwy 17-A. I missed it by inches. I didn’t hear a thud so I assume and hope it got across the highway safely. Good commute. Lets do it again tomorrow. Ride on.
Relive ‘Commute PM’

item.title: Commute Tuesday January 29, 2019
item.description: The weather forecast called for rain around 5PM which would have been perfect if I left by 4PM. By lunch time I knew the rain was going to be here sooner than that. I left work a couple hours early to beat the rain. Drizzled most of the way home but no downpour. Stiff headwind accompanied the drizzle. Not one of my best commutes. Thursday’s forecast calls for a low of 28â„‰.

item.title: Commute Friday January 25, 2019
Commute Wednesday January 23, 2019
Commute Thursday January 17, 2019
item.description: According to my Garmin it was 26â„‰ this morning and 64â„‰ on the way home. Guess which segment I enjoyed more? On the way home I was passed, at a high rate of speed, by a couple of dozen police vehicles with sirens blaring. They were mostly Berkeley County Sheriff vehicles. The others were unmarked. I don’t know what was going down but I assume it was pretty serious. Looking forward to the 3 day weekend.

item.title: Commute Tuesday January 15, 2019
Commute Thursday January 10, 2019
Commute Tuesday January 8, 2019
item.description: Another great day in the South Carolina Lowcountry. No drama commute. Ride on. Relive ‘Commute PM’

item.title: Commute Thursday January 3, 2019
Commute Friday December 21, 2018
item.description: The wind was whipping today nearly knocking me over a few times. Even with an awesome tailwind I can’t snag a KOM. There are Strava 3 segments on the way to work. I am 2nd, 3rd, and 4th on the all time rankings. I thought today I might get my first KOM but I was still 34 seconds slower than the leader on the smaller of the 3 segments. Oh well, the ride to work was a lot of fun.

item.title: Commute Tuesday December 18, 2018
item.description: Thought more than once about driving to work but saddled up. I’m glad I did. Another good commute in the books. Relive ‘Commute AM’

item.title: Commute Thursday December 13, 2018
item.description: Nothing like a bike ride to relieve work place stress. The ride home was just what the doctor ordered. Ride on. Relive ‘Commute AM’

item.title: Commute Tuesday December 11, 2018
Commute Tuesday December 4, 2018
Commute Thursday November 29, 2018
Commute Tuesday November 27, 2018
Commute Tuesday November 20, 2018
item.description: Moncks Corner put out there Christmas decorations just in time for Thanksgiving. Commute was good. Traffic was a smidgen lighter due to the upcoming holiday. I have a 4 day weekend. Too bad the best weather day is Thanksgiving day. I’ll squeeze in some miles between the rain showers. New lighter colored carpet was installed in my place of employment. I purchased a mat for my office where I park my bike in the bikehand.

item.title: Commute Wednesday November 14, 2018
item.description: This must be what riding a penny-farthing feels like. My new bike fit has me higher and more upright. Felt like my quadriceps were working harder today. So far, so good. Windy day. Head wind on the way to work and tail wind on the way home. 16.4 MPH vs 21.3 MPH. Enjoyed the ride home 100 times more than the ride to work. There was rain to our northwest and offshore but not a drop in Moncks Corner or Summerville.

item.title: Commute Thursday November 1, 2018
Commute Tuesday October 30, 2018
Commute Thursday October 25, 2018
Commute Tuesday October 23, 2018
Commute Thursday October 18, 2018
Commute Tuesday October 16, 2018
item.description: Maximum temperature on the commute home was 84.2 Â°F according to Garmin. I think it was closer to 90 Â°F. All I know for sure is the weather is awesome for mid October. More of this please! Relive ‘Commute AM’

item.title: Commute Friday October 12, 2018
item.description: Thursday tropical storm Michael was passing to the west of us. I contemplated riding to perhaps get a tail wind assisted KOM but I came to my senses. I drove my EV to work yesterday and cycled today. 55.4 Â°F was the low temperature during my AM commute. I don’t like what is coming. I don’t like it at all. I rather sweat than freeze any day. It won’t be long before the Gore jacket and gloves are needed.

item.title: Commute Tuesday October 9, 2018
item.description: Fender bender at Carnes Crossroads intersection caused a traffic jam for what seemed like more than a mile on Hwy 17-A. Good day to be on two wheels. Relive ‘Commute AM’

item.title: Commute Thursday October 4, 2018
item.description:
Nice weather. Productive week at work so far. Two good commutes and 64 miles logged. Looking forward to the weekend. Not sure where I’m riding but I’m riding. Upgraded my Garmin 520 to version 12.80. It wiped out my settings. Most importantly my sensors. I had to set the sensors up again. Software upgrades should not wipe out user settings. First world problems. Rock on!
Relive ‘Commute AM’

item.title: Commute Tuesday October 2, 2018
Commute Wednesday September 26, 2018
item.description: Good temperatures, sunny skies, and tolerable traffic make for a good commute.

item.title: Commute Thursday September 20, 2018
item.description: Grant Ford wrote Morning Trek for me in return for a small donation towards his writing projects. I’m happy with my return on investment. It captures some of the joys of cycling. #Morning Trek A breath of cool air, the smell of pavement entrance and entice the morning senses with freedom from the daily enslavement of cars and trucks and motorized fences. With the strength of will, the body exerts upon the gears of destiny and fate to consume the miles combustion preverts; you breathe the clean air, your spirit to sate.

item.title: Commute Tuesday September 18, 2018
item.description: It was pouring down rain around 4 AM. I went back to sleep and when I awoke at 5 AM the rain had stopped. I checked RadarScope. There were storms to the south and to the north but nothing between Summerville and Moncks Corner so I stuck to my plan. The road was wet but not a drop of rain fell on me. RadarScope is awesome. Good ride to work. A couple of hours later my back tire went flat.

item.title: Commute Tuesday September 11, 2018
item.description: Traffic was light with Hurricane Florence heading towards the southeastern and mid-Atlantic United States. I wish the traffic was this light everyday. The cover photo for today’s log was taken on the way back from dinner. It is I-26 exit 199 with all lanes heading west to Columbia SC. Lane reversals started at noon September 11, 2018.

item.title: Commute Thursday September 6, 2018
item.description: Biked to work just one day this week due to me being a light weight after my Labor Day century ride. I’ll get two commutes next week. â˜®

item.title: Commute Thursday August 30, 2018
item.description: There was a fatal automobile accident at the Black Tom Rd and Hwy 17-A intersection this morning. Rest in â˜®. I reached the scene about 20 minutes afterwards. The police had the intersection taped off. All traffic was diverted. I was able to cycle around the barrier and get to work. My Topeak backloader bag was not strapped as tight as it should have been and sounded like a frog for most of the AM commute.

item.title: Commute Tuesday August 28, 2018
Thursday Commute
item.description: Cycling yields quality spirits. I am happy with the way the photo in front of Watkins Package Store developed. ðŸ“· It was a split decision to take a photo here. So much so I almost wipe out when I turned off the road into a sand mound. Crisis averted and photo snapped. Up at 5 AM and pedaling by 5:21 AM. Had a head wind on the way to work and a tail on the way home.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: Made it to work in 46 minutes thanks to a tail wind. The wind didn’t shift during the day so I had a stiff head wind on the way home. The wind giveth and taketh away. I haven’t commuted on the bike lately in lieu of evening rides. This commute was a little different in that I carried my clothes to work in my Topeak Backloader bag. Normally I store clothes in my office when I drive the EV.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: The Garmin 520 recorded 59Â°F as the low temperature. That is crazy low for July. I almost needed my arm warmers. High temperature on the ride home was 86â„‰ which was pleasant. I must admit waking up before 5 AM to beat the traffic is getting old. Still waiting on a road to connect to Black Tom Rd that may provide a safer and later ride.

item.title: Heat Advisory Headwind
item.description: Rode the bicycle to work since I dropped off my Chevy Bolt EV yesterday for scheduled maintenance. Left work a little after 3PM and cycled to Rick Hendrick Chevrolet in Charleston to pick up the Bolt. There was a heat advisory and a headwind. The Garmin recorded 100.4 Â°F as the high and 94.0 Â°F as the average. Not sure what the humidity was but it was high. I faced a headwind today which I guess is fair since I had a tailwind yesterday.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: Gloomy overcast day. No sun but no rain either. Had a bit of a tailwind on the way home giving me a decent moving time of 47:29.

item.title: Thursday Commute
item.description: Good ride into work in under 50 minutes moving time. Always pleased with sub 50 minute rides. The ride home had a rain delay. Planned to leave work at 4 PM but a shower popped up and rained pretty hard. Worked for another hour. The road was steaming for the first few miles and all dry the rest of the way home. After showering I cycled over to Taco Bell for some black bean burritos.

item.title: Friday Commute
item.description: Long day. Woke up at 4:00 AM and was on the road by 5:00 AM. Left the office around 5:20 PM. My bike has a clicking squeaky noise. I’m guessing it is from the saddle. Took the saddle off and removed a good bit of dirt. Hopefully that was cause. Temperatures are on the way up. It was approaching 90 â„‰. May 2018 was the wettest month ever in Charleston SC.

item.title: Wet Wednesday Commute
item.description: Rain and more rain. As of this writing this is second wettest May of all time for Charleston SC. Bring on a dry hot June. I brought my Nvidia Shield to work for a coworker to borrow. I packed it in my Topeak Backloader bicycle bag and it stayed dry. Yay! I was able to cycle to lunch without getting rained. Yay again! The ride home was a soaker but at least the winds were calm and the temperature was a comfortable 69.

item.title: Thursday Commute
item.description: Tried a new route on the morning commute. I got off of Hwy 17-A at Gaillard Rd over to Old Hwy 52. Nice change of scenery. It was not quite a mile longer. The afternoon commute got off to a slow start. Before I could work up a sweat I was stopped by not one but two trains. The first freight train was long and slow. Towards the end with just a dozen cars left to pass the crossing a second freight train coming from the opposite direction appeared.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: Nice rides to work and back. No uptight automobile drivers. Damp tarmac and a little drizzle on the way home. No worries.

item.title: National Bike to Work Day
item.description: Today was National Bike to Work Day. I usually bike to work on Tuesday and Thursday but I switched this week to Wednesday and Friday to align with BTWD. We had on and off again rain all day. I managed to escape all but a few drops here and there. Pretty nice rides. Below is a snippet of my ride home. I’m not proud of this part of my ride but I just don’t feel like stopping in traffic.

item.title: Wednesday Commute
item.description: Picked up Old Yeller from Mike’s Bikes yesterday. It has a new rear derailleur, chain, rear tire, and cassette. The ride to work was super smooth. Really glad to have the Giant Anyroad 1 back. It is so much nicer than my backup bike, Giant Defy 3. I can’t recall an average MPH of 20 so I think this was a personal best. There is something motivational about a new drivetrain.

item.title: Thursday Commute, Post Chipotle Ride and Topeak Chain Tool
item.description: Thursday’s commute was uneventful. I rode to Chipotle for dinner and afterwards rode up Hwy 78. I was going to take N Maple St to the Nexton Parkway but couldn’t find N Maple St. Looked at Google Maps when I got home and realized I should have traveled a few more blocks. I headed back up 17-A and took Holiday Dr to Nexton Parkway instead. Even though I had been on Nexton Parkway many times this was the first time with automobile traffic.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: Tuesday’s commute was uneventful. I snapped a photo of The Corner Cafe Bakery in Moncks Corner SC. It recently closed. A Starbucks recently opened and I assume that might have played into The Corner’s decision to close. I had a rare tailwind on the way home which enabled me to break my 50 minute barrier again. Nice!

item.title: Thursday Commute
item.description: Wheee - just having fun! Gorgeous weather continues. I didn’t like the way my rear hub was sounding so I dropped off my Giant Anyroad 1 bike at Mike’s Bikes in Mt Pleasant. Asked them to check all the bearings. Hopeful it will be a one day turn around so I can have it for the weekend. If not I’ll be riding my Giant Defy 3 and wishing I was on my Anyroad 1.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: Tuesday’s commute had a big temperature swing. According to my Garmin 520 bicycle computer the minimum temperature was 39â„‰ and the maximum temperature was 82â„‰. That is a 43â„‰ swing.

item.title: Thursday Commute
item.description: My Thursday commute was dry, comfortable, and uneventful. I got up at 5 AM and was on the road by 5:30 AM. I think I will stick with this schedule. I’d like to sleep an hour later but it is not worth the increased traffic.

item.title: Tuesday Commute
item.description: Tuesday commute started out wet with mist and a couple of showers. The ride home was dry, unlike my shoes, and partly cloudy. One thing is for sure the traffic is far better at 5:30 AM than at 6:30 AM. The traffic is lighter and a little less frantic. Absolutely worth getting up at 5 AM for.

item.title: Personal Best on AM Commute
item.description: Had a rare tailwind this morning and it helped me achieve my personal best moving time of 46:59. I also had a little help from a slow moving 18 wheeler.

item.title: Contemplating the Commute
item.description: Contemplating my twice-a-week bicycle commute. It is 16.2 miles between Moncks Corner and Summerville. Most of the ride is on Hwy 17-A which is a busy 4 lane highway. The section from my apartment in Summerville to Cypress Gardens Rd is the busiest section. Cypress Gardens Rd intersection to Moncks Corner is lower traffic and a pleasant ride. Pros 4 hours of exercise a week Green Commute Enjoyable Accomplishing 2 things a once (commute and exercise) Cons Dangerous Abuse from drivers (yelling, honking, revving, close drive by) The benefits are many but sometimes feel that I am being irresponsible to my family and to my employer by risking my life on my bike.

item.title: Commute Wednesday April 11, 2018
item.description: Broke my cheap clear sunglasses before I got out the door. On the ride to work I got honked at once and yelled at once. A passenger in a truck yelled “Get on the sidewalk!”. Yeah, that ain’t happening. 16 miles on a sidewalk would not be fun. We’ve got new pavement on Main St in Moncks Corner SC. So nice. The road was in really bad shape. Love cycling on new tarmac.
